title: Commission Regulation (EEC) No 1885/89 of 28 June 1989 determining the maximum amount of the compensation for tuna supplied to the canning industry for the period 1 January to 30 June 1988
header:
COMMISSION  REGULATION (EEC) No 1885/89
of 28 June 1989
determining the maximum amount of the compensation for tuna supplied to the canning industry for the period 1 January to 30 June 1988
THE COMMISSION OF THE EUROPEAN COMMUNITIES
main_body:
The compensation referred to in Article 17 of Regulation (EEC) No 3796/81 shall apply for the first two quarters of
the 1988 fishing year for the product and within the limits of the maximum amounts determined as follows:
- for the period 1 January to 31 March 1988:
(ECU/tonne)
1.2 //  //  // Product  // Maximum amount of compensation  //    //   // Yellowfin tuna, whole, weighing not more than 10 kg each   // 134   //    //
- for the period 1 April to 30 June 1988:
(ECU/tonne)
1.2 //  //  // Product  // Maximum amount of compensation  //    //   // Yellowfin tuna, whole, weighing not more than 10 kg each   // 159   //    //

This Regulation shall enter into force on the third day following its publication in the Official Journal of the European Communities.
This Regulation shall be binding in its entirety and directly applicable in all Member States.
attachments:
Done at Brussels, 28 June 1989.
For the Commission
Manuel MARĂN
Vice-President
